title: SCAM Pipe Generator Options Schema

examples.description: Generate a pipe with the exported symbol matching the file name. It results in the pipe `FooPipe` at `mylib/src/lib/foo.pipe.ts`
Generate a pipe without providing the file extension. It results in the pipe `FooPipe` at `mylib/src/lib/foo.pipe.ts`
Generate a pipe with the exported symbol different from the file name. It results in the pipe `CustomPipe` at `mylib/src/lib/foo.pipe.ts`

description: Creates a new, generic Angular pipe definition in the given or default project.

path.description: The file path to the SCAM pipe. Relative to the current working directory.
path.x-prompt: What is the SCAM pipe file path?

name.description: The pipe symbol name. Defaults to the last segment of the file path.

skipTests.description: Do not create `spec.ts` test files for the new pipe.

inlineScam.description: Create the NgModule in the same file as the Pipe.

export.description: Specifies if the SCAM should be exported from the project's entry point (normally `index.ts`). It only applies to libraries.

typeSeparator.description: The separator character to use before the type within the generated file's name. For example, if you set the option to `.`, the file will be named `example.pipe.ts`. It defaults to '-' for Angular v20+. For versions below v20, it defaults to '.'.
